Test.Comment: Schemamapping: test if a user can export his schema and import it as another user.

Statement.CallString: create user t1t password t1t dba

Test.Comment: Schemamapping: test if a user can import one of his schemas under another name (SCHEMANAME <> username)

Statement.CallString: create user t2 password t2 dba
create schemamap t2map map schema t2schema1 to t2schema2
select SCHEMANAME, TABLENAME from domain.tables where SCHEMANAME='T2SCHEMA2'

Test.Comment: IMPORT: SYNONYMS for tables. Synonyms seem to be excepted from export/import.

Statement.CallString: CREATE USER T5 PASSWORD T5 DBA
SELECT synonymname, TABLENAME FROM domain.synonyms where tableSCHEMANAME='T5'

Test.Comment: SCHEMAMAPPING of a schema containing synonyms

Statement.CallString: create user t6t password t6t dba
create schemamap t6map map schema t6 to t6t
select synonymname, TABLENAME from domain.synonyms where TABLESCHEMANAME='T6T'

Test.Comment: Import: Grants on tables

Statement.CallString: CREATE USER t7eins PASSWORD t7eins DBA
CREATE USER t7zwei PASSWORD t7zwei DBA
select SCHEMANAME, TABLENAME, GRANTOR, GRANTEE, privilege from domain.tableprivileges where OWNER='T7EINS' and TABLENAME='T7TABLE'

Test.Comment: SCHEMAMAPPING: Grants on tables

Statement.CallString: create user t8eins password t8eins dba
create user t8zwei password t8zwei dba
import SCHEMA t8schema1 map schema t8schema1 to t8schema2 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t8.catalog'
select SCHEMANAME, TABLENAME, GRANTOR, GRANTEE, privilege from domain.tableprivileges where OWNER='T8EINS' and TABLENAME='T8TABLE'

Test.Comment:
SCHEMAMAPPING. foreign keys (test if changing the name of a schema affects referential constraints of tables from other schemas) T9Schema1->t9Schema11
False

Statement.CallString: create user t9 password t9 dba
import schema t9schema1 map schema t9schema1 to t9schema11 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t9.catalog'
select SCHEMANAME, TABLENAME, fkeyname from domain.foreignkeys where fkeyname='F_T1'

Test.Comment:
EXPORT: foreign keys (schema containing tables referencing tables from another schema function correctly. Both schemas belong to the same user)
False

Statement.CallString: create user t10 password t10 dba
select SCHEMANAME, TABLENAME, fkeyname from domain.foreignkeys where fkeyname='F_T1'

Test.Comment: IMPORT: sequences.The Schema contains only a sequence. It's definition is not written in the export catalog.

Statement.CallString: create user t11 password t11 dba
select SCHEMANAME, SEQUENCE_NAME, MIN_VALUE, INCREMENT_BY from domain.sequences where SEQUENCE_NAME='T11SEQUENCE'

Test.Comment:
Import: Grants on Columns
Correct

Statement.CallString: create user t12e password t12e dba
create user t12z password t12z dba
select SCHEMANAME, TABLENAME, COLUMNNAME, columnprivileges from domain.columns where SCHEMANAME='T12SCHEMA' and OWNER='T12E' and TABLENAME='T12TABLE'

Test.Comment:
Schemapping: Grants on Columns
Correct

Statement.CallString: create user t13e password t13e dba
create user t13z password t13z dba
import schema t13schema1 map schema t13schema1 to t13schema2 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t13.catalog'
select SCHEMANAME, TABLENAME, COLUMNNAME, columnprivileges from domain.columns where SCHEMANAME='T13SCHEMA2' and OWNER='T13E' and TABLENAME='T13TABLE'

Test.Comment:
Import: Grant on Schema
False

Statement.CallString: create user t14eins password t14eins dba
create user t14zwei password t14zwei dba
select SCHEMANAME, GRANTEE, GRANTOR, CREATEIN, GRANTOPTION from domain.schemaprivileges where SCHEMANAME='T14SCHEMA'
select SCHEMANAME, TABLENAME from domain.tables where TABLENAME='T14TABLE'

Test.Comment: SCHEMAMAPPING: Grants on Schema

Statement.CallString: create user t15eins password t15eins dba
create user t15zwei password t15zwei dba
create schemamap t15map map schema t15schema1 to t15schema2
select SCHEMANAME, GRANTEE, GRANTOR, CREATEIN, GRANTOPTION from domain.schemaprivileges where SCHEMANAME='T15SCHEMA2'
select SCHEMANAME, TABLENAME from domain.tables where TABLENAME='T15TABLE'

Test.Comment:
Schemamapping: Views based on tables of the same schema
Correct

Statement.CallString: create user t16 password t16 dba
import schema t16schema1 map schema t16schema1 to t16schema2 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t16.catalog'

Test.Comment:
Import: Views based on tables of more than one schema.
False

Statement.CallString: create user t17 password t17 dba
import schema t17schema2 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t17bis.catalog' data instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t17bis_generated.data'
import schema t17schema1 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t17.catalog' data instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t17_generated.data'

Test.Comment: Schemamapping: Views based on tables of more than one schema False

Statement.CallString: import schema t18schema2 map schema t18schema2 to t18schema22 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t18bis.catalog' data instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t18bis_generated.data' records
import schema t18schema1 map schema t18schema1 to t18schema11 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t18.catalog' data instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t18_generated.data' records

Test.Comment:
Import: Grants on views
true

Statement.CallString: create user t19eins password t19eins dba
create user t19zwei password t19zwei dba

Test.Comment: Schemamapping: Grants on views based on tables of the same schema. Correct

Statement.CallString: create user t20eins password t20eins dba
create user t20zwei password t20zwei dba
import schema t20schema1 map schema t20schema1 to t20schema2 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t20.catalog'

Test.Comment: IMPORT: Trigger

Statement.CallString: create user t21 password t21 dba
select SCHEMANAME, OWNER, TABLENAME, TRIGGERNAME, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE from domain.triggers where TABLENAME='T21TABLE'

Test.Comment: Schemamapping: Trigger

Statement.CallString: create user t22 password t22 dba
import schema t22schema1 map schema t22schema1 to t22schema2 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t22.catalog'
select SCHEMANAME, OWNER, TABLENAME, TRIGGERNAME, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE from domain.triggers where TABLENAME='T22TABLE'

Test.Comment: IMPORT. DBPROCEDURE

Statement.CallString: create user t23 password t23 dba
select SCHEMANAME, DBPROCNAME, PARAMETER, CURSOR_SUPPORT from domain.dbprocedures where SCHEMANAME='T23SCHEMA'

Test.Comment: Schemamapping: DBPROCEDURE

Statement.CallString: create user t24 password t24 dba
create schemamap t24map map schema t24schema1 to t24schema2
select SCHEMANAME, DBPROCNAME, PARAMETER, CURSOR_SUPPORT from domain.dbprocedures where SCHEMANAME='T24SCHEMA2'

Test.Comment: IMPORT: Function

Statement.CallString: create user t25 password t25 dba
select SCHEMANAME, functionname, PARAMETER from domain.functions where SCHEMANAME='T25SCHEMA'

Test.Comment: Schemamapping: FUNCTIONS

Statement.CallString: create user t26 password t26 dba
create schemamap t26map map schema t26schema1 to t26schema2
select SCHEMANAME, functionname, PARAMETER from domain.functions where SCHEMANAME='T26SCHEMA2'

Test.Comment: Import Grant Execute DBPROCEDURE

Statement.CallString: create user t27eins password t27eins dba
create user t27zwei password t27zwei dba

Test.Comment: Schemamapping: Grant execute DBPROCEDURE

Statement.CallString: create user t28eins password t28eins dba
create user t28zwei password t28zwei dba
create schemamap t28map map schema t28schema1 to t28schema2

Test.Comment: SCHEMAMAPPING: Sequences. The schema contains just the sequence

Statement.CallString: create user t29 password t29 dba
create schemamap t29map map schema t29schema1 to t29schema2
select SCHEMANAME, SEQUENCE_NAME, MIN_VALUE, INCREMENT_BY from domain.sequences where SEQUENCE_NAME='T29SEQUENCE'

Test.Comment: IMPORT: Schema contains both sequences and tables

Statement.CallString: create user t30 password t30 dba
select SCHEMANAME, SEQUENCE_NAME, MIN_VALUE, INCREMENT_BY from domain.sequences where SEQUENCE_NAME='T30SEQUENCE'

Test.Comment: SCHEMAMAPPING: Schema contains both sequences and Tables

Statement.CallString: create user t31 password t31 dba
create schemamap t31map map schema t31schema1 to t31schema2
select SCHEMANAME, SEQUENCE_NAME, MIN_VALUE, INCREMENT_BY from domain.sequences where SEQUENCE_NAME='T31SEQUENCE'

Test.Comment: Schemamapping: Views based on tables of more than one schema

Statement.CallString: create schemamap t32schemamap map schema t32schema1 to t32schema11, t32schema2 to t32schema22
import schema t32schema2 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t32bis.catalog' data instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t32bis_generated.data' records
import schema t32schema1 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t32.catalog' data instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t32_generated.data' records

Test.Comment: Schemamapping: Views based on tables of more than one schema

Statement.CallString: create schemamap t33schemamap map schema t33schema1 to t33schema11, t33schema2 to t33schema22
import schema t33schema2 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t33bis.catalog' data instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t33bis_generated.data' pages
import schema t33schema1 map schema t33schema1 to t33schema11 catalog instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t33.catalog' data instream '<infile_path>eSchemaV76_t33_generated.data' pages
